meanings.definition: A system of society or government in which men hold the power and women are largely excluded.
meanings.sent1: In some patriarchies, only men are allowed to make important decisions.
meanings.sent2: Historically, many ancient civilizations were patriarchies where men had more authority.
meanings.sent3: The patriarchies in fairy tales often depict kings ruling over their kingdoms.
meanings.sent4: The patriarchies of old cast a long shadow over the roles of men and women.
meanings.sent5: The concept of patriarchies can be seen in various historical texts and documents.

meanings.definition: Societies in which power is held by men, particularly by fathers or elder males.
meanings.sent1: Some patriarchies follow a tradition where leadership is passed down from father to son.
meanings.sent2: In certain patriarchies, the eldest male member of the family makes all major decisions.
meanings.sent3: The patriarchies in rural areas often revolve around the authority of the oldest male relative.
meanings.sent4: The patriarchies of olden times were deeply rooted in familial hierarchies.
meanings.sent5: The concept of patriarchies shapes the dynamics within many communities.

meanings.definition: The dominance of men in social or cultural systems.
meanings.sent1: Gender roles in patriarchies often limit the opportunities available to women.
meanings.sent2: Patriarchies tend to prioritize the voices and perspectives of men over women.
meanings.sent3: The patriarchies in literature sometimes exaggerate the power dynamics between genders.
meanings.sent4: The patriarchies of society can influence how individuals perceive gender norms.
meanings.sent5: The impact of patriarchies on cultural norms is a topic of ongoing discussion.
